item.title: Hypothesis: vitamin D and probiotics will reduce type II diabetes
item.description:
Vitamin D and Prebiotics May Benefit the Intestinal Microbacteria and Improve Glucose Homeostasis in Prediabetes and Type 2 Diabetes.

Endocr Pract. 2013 Jan 21:1-40.

Barengolts E.

Section of Endocrinology, Department of Medicine, University of Illinois Medical Center and Jesse Brown VA Medical Center, Chicago, Illinois.

Objective: To review the role of human large bowel microbacteria (microbiota) in the glucose homeostasis, to address vitamin D (VD) and prebiotics interactions with microbiota, and to summarize recent randomized clinical trials (RCT) of VD and prebiotics supplementation in prediabetes and T2DM.

item.title: Hypothesis: antibiotic resistant bacteria can be controlled with vitamin D
Soft Bones, Hard Arteries, Vitamin D, Vitamin K2 and antibiotics
Reasons for low response to vitamin D
item.description:
• Overview of Poor Response
      • Detailed Reasons for poor response
      • Reasons for not getting benefits - even if blood tests are OK
      • Big differences in UVB responses: 20 to 36 ng after 6 weeks
      • Alternate sources of vitamin D

Overview of Poor Response

~ 50% of all people have a low response to vitamin D3

item.title: Less than 1 percent of the genes in your body are even mammalian
